hero.subtitle: An inclusive community, driven by a spirit of solidarity. Together, we break barriers and create opportunities.

mission.title: OUR MISSIONS
mission.discover: Discover the story behind our actions

objectives.title: OUR OBJECTIVES
objectives.obj1_desc: Promote, Prevent, and Protect the rights of deaf women in particular and citizens in general in the areas of health, education, and entrepreneurship.
objectives.obj2_desc: Actively promote gender equality, social inclusion, and fight against all forms of discrimination within the community.
objectives.obj3_desc: Fight hunger by addressing food deficits through the promotion and dissemination of innovative and sustainable agricultural techniques.
objectives.obj4_desc: Provide legal support to deaf women, particularly victims of violence, to ensure equitable access to justice.
objectives.obj5_desc: Defend the rights of vulnerable women and those living with a disability, victims of gender-based violence.
objectives.obj6_desc: Sensitize the public and institutions to the specific needs of deaf women, and advocate for inclusive policies (health, violence prevention, employment).
objectives.obj7_desc: Organize workshops, conferences, and support groups to develop women's skills (leadership, literacy, professional integration).
objectives.obj8_desc: Create links with other organizations defending the rights of women and the deaf to increase the visibility of deaf women in Congolese and global society.
objectives.obj9_desc: Respond to specific challenges such as social isolation and sexual violence experienced based on the context of deafness.

about.hero_subtitle: ASAFS is a non-profit organization founded in 2020. Discover our history, our objectives, and the vision that drives us daily.
about.quote: Empowering deaf women is not just a goal, it is a social justice imperative. Through ASAFS, we build a bridge between silence and opportunity.

timeline_items.title: Awakening of Consciousness
timeline_items.text: Beginning of awareness and education actions on gender issues.

timeline_items.title: Protection & Support
timeline_items.text: Creation of the first legal clinics for women victims of SGBV.

timeline_items.title: Expansion of Rights
timeline_items.text: Strengthening of the provincial legal and social support network.

timeline_items.title: Consolidation
timeline_items.text: Expansion of training programs for economic empowerment.

programs.hero_subtitle: We train deaf women in the professions of tomorrow for sustainable independence.
programs.p1_desc: Learn modern sewing techniques and adapted fashion design.
programs.p2_desc: Master essential digital tools to navigate today's world.

donate.hero_subtitle: Your donation funds the education and empowerment of deaf women in DRC.
donate.title: Contribute
donate.why_support_intro: Your generosity is the engine of our change. By giving to ASAFS, you directly participate in:
donate.transparency_desc: Every penny is a promise kept. We document every action so your help reaches where it's truly needed.
donate.lives_changed_desc: You're not just making a donation, you're breaking chains of silence to restore a voice to those the world forgets.
donate.direct_impact_desc: No intermediaries. We are on the ground, alongside our sisters, to transform their daily lives into a future of dignity.
donate.justice_desc: Disability should no longer be a condemnation. Together, we restore fundamental rights and honor to every woman.
donate.did_you_know_text: A $50 donation funds 1 month of professional training for a deaf woman.

success.title: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROSITY
success.subtitle: Your donation has been successfully received. Thanks to you, we continue to offer a better future for deaf women in DRC.
success.impact_desc: At this very moment, your contribution is allocated to our vocational training and sign language learning programs.

dictionary.subtitle: Learn French Sign Language (LSF) with our comprehensive pedagogical guide. An interactive resource to break communication barriers.
dictionary.search_placeholder: Search for a sign, a letter...
dictionary.no_results: No results found for your search.
dictionary.advice_text: Practice is key. Try repeating each sign in front of a mirror to check your position. Sign Language is not just about hands—don't forget to use your facial expression to give context to your messages.
